lines.text: You lousy cork-soakers. You have violated my farging rights. Dis somanumbatching country was founded so that the liberties of common patriotic citizens like me could not be taken away by a bunch of fargin iceholes... like yourselves.
You shouldn't grab me, Johnny. My mother grabbed me once... ONCE!
Get this to Johnny on the grapevine. Vermin is going to kill Johnny's brother at the savoy theater tomorrow night. Got it?
Got it.
[flies away]

[arrives at prison mess hall and lands on the shoulder of a prisoner]
Vermin is going to kill Johnny's brother at the Savoy theater. Pass it on.

[to the next prisoner sitting next to him]
Vermin is going to kill Johnny's brother at the Savoy theater tonight. Pass it on.

[to the next prisoner, "telephone" style]
Vermin is going to kill Johnny's mother at the Savoy theater tonight. Pass it on.

[to the next prisoner]
Vermin's mother is going to kill Johnny tonight at the Savoy theater. Pass it on.
[to the next prisoner]
[unintelligible]
... at the Savoy. Pass it on.
There's a message through the grapevine, Johnny.
Yeah? What is it?
Johnny and the Mothers are playing "Stompin' at the Savoy" in Vermont tonight.
Vermin's going to kill my brother at the Savoy theater tonight.
I didn't say that.
No, but I know this grapevine.
I got something to stop him.
[draws a gun with an unusually long barrel]
They made it for him special. It's an .88 Magnum.
It shoots through schools.
How's tricks, Moroni?
What are you doing here, icehole?
Hey, can't a fellow enjoy a night out gambling with some of his pals?
Don't bullshtein me.
[to one of his men]
Search this somanabatch.
Why you miserable cork-soaker!

[points to a parking space]
Park there.

[objects]
It's for the handicapped.
I AM handicapped. I'm psychotic.
[puts a sign in the front window]
This is fargin war!
[Ma Kelly is pouring drinks for everybody]
Mom, it's prohibition!
Oh, shut up! Stop acting like some fag choir boy!
You shouldn't hang me on a hook, Johnny. My father hung me on a hook once. Once!
I've been fulfilling a lot of people's prophecies about me; I've become a real scumbag.
Your turn, Johnny. The priest you've requested has arrived.

[pretending to be a priest]
Are you ready, my son?
I'm ready if you are, father.
Dominus vobiscum, Nabisco. Espiritu sanctu. They gasthebus.

[hands Johnny a part of a tommy gun]
So long, Johnny.
We gasthebus. You gasthebus. We missed the bus. They missed the bus.

[hands Johnny another piece of the gun]
Be brave, huh, Johnny.
When's the next bus?

[begins putting the gun together behind the wardens back]
Always, Nails.
Summa cum laude. Magna cum laude. The radio's too laude. Adeste fidelis.

[gives Johnny another piece]
Good luck, Johnny.
Semper fidelis. High fidelis.

[struggling to put it together]
Why didn't I take shop?
Post Meridian. Ante Meridian. Uncle Meridian. All the little Meridians.

[adds another piece]
Bye bye, Johnny.

[adds piece to gun]
Bye, Rock.
The Magna Carta. MasterCharge it.

[hands piece to Johnny]
Spit in his eye, Johnny!

[finishes putting the gun together]
OK, rabbi.

[opens his bible to reveal the guns clip]
Dum procellas. Lotsa Vitalis.
Any last words, Johnny?
[gun cocks]

[turns to see Johnny pointing a tommy gun at him]
Well said!
The name's Dangerously. Johnny Dangerously.
Did you know you're last name is an adverb?

[admires Lil's figure]
You got those. I like those on a woman.
The years hadn't softened Moronie. He continued to murder the English Language, and anyone who got in his way.

[to Mrs. Kelly]
You shouldn't kick me in the balls, lady. My sister kicked me in the balls once...
[Stumbles in pain]
[Leaving a crime scene with his sidekick, Dutch]
Hey, doll, how'd you like to make some money?
One at a time, or both of you together?

You fargin sneaky bastage. I'm gonna take your dwork. I'm gonna nail it to the wall. I'm gonna crush your boils in a meat grinder. I'm gonna cut off your arms. I'm gonna shove 'em up your icehole. Dirty son-a-ma-batches. My own club!

[when Vermin walks on the floor while she is mopping it]
Oh, you lousy, Wop, Slovak, Chink, Jap, Polack, Mick, Krauts, Hebe fags!
Bless the saints, it's an ashtray! I've been thinking of taking up smoking. This clinches it!
I enjoy collecting protection money, putting whores to work, loan-sharking. I enjoy planting bombs in people's cars. These are a few of my favorite things.
You know, Danny, I think you get too much sugar in your diet.
[In the middle of a trial]
the Mother's Day Massacre, The Christmas Day Slaughter, The Lincoln's Birthday Mutilations, and The Groundhog's Day Be-headings!
This goes through armor. And through the victim, through the wall, through a tree outside...
You shouldn't have shot me, Johnny. My grandmother shot me once...

[when Johnny walks on the floor while she is mopping it]
Dirty Jew! Shanty nigger! White-trash bastard! Go ahead, walk all over the little people!

[scoffs at Johnny's interest in Lil]
Dames are put on this earth to weaken us. Drain our energy. Laugh at us when they see us naked.
I know what you can't say. You wanna get laid.
Mom!
You wanna hump your brains out.
[Tommy clamps his hands over Sally's ears]

[does mock pushups]
Baboom, baboom, baboom, baboom!
[Tommy drags Sally from the room]
You were gonna take a bullet for me.
Actually, I was just counting on a lot of missing.
I never should have picked a name like that. A name like that you gotta live up to. What's your last name?
Binzerhoff.
Binzerhoff? Perfect. Keep that name and you'll stay out of trouble.
I'm not wearing a bra, Johnny.
Yeah? Well that makes two of us.
So when I was 18 I left home and came here to Chicago.
Uh Lil, this ain't Chicago. We're in New York.
You're kidding.
[pause]
Well, New York, Chicago, to a girl on her own, it's all the same.
Oh God! How do you get laid in 1930?

[Ma Kelly pours a shot for Tommy]
Mom, it's Prohibition.
Aw, shut up! Stop acting like a fag choir boy.
Alright here it is. Johnny Dangerously is going legit.
Le-what?
Legit.
Le-why?
I'll tell you le-why. Because Johnny Dangerously is really Johnny Kelly, brother of the D.A., Tommy Kelly.
Open up! It's Ma Kelly!

[opens her door]
What do you want? Get out of here.
I got to talk to you.
We don't have nothing to say to each other.
We got plenty to say to each other. We got a lot in common.
Yeah, what?
We both scrub floors. We're both swell lookers. And neither one of us is Chinese.
Dr. Magnus, how's my mother?
It's her pancreas again, Johnny. She's gonna need an operation immediately.
How much is it gonna cost?
This week only.
Where am I gonna get that kind of money?
Why don't you knock over a gas station?

jobs, security, laughs. America was in great shape, except for the President, William Howard Taft. Was HE a porker. At 310 lbs. he weighed as much as Teddy Roosevelt and half of William McKinley. Immigrants poured into the country from all over the world looking for a better life for their children. And over 97% of them settled into a two-block area of New York City.
Hi Dr. Magnus. How's my mother?
It's her thyroid, Johnny.
What's wrong with it?
We can't find it. Gonna have to do a thyroid search.
How much is that gonna cost?
You're in luck. This week a special. $999 dollars.
Okey! You and the rest of your bastages can gamble, but don't try no fargin trick, otherwise you wind up with your bells in a sling.
Commissioner, there's all the evidence against me, just like I promised you. Use it. I'm ready to pay my debt.
[No response from Commissioner]
Hey, how about a thank you?
[Johnny notices that the Commissioner is dead]
Hey, how about me getting out of here?
[Johnny turns to leave but is hit on the head]
Hey, how about me getting knocked out?
[He falls]
The Lower East Side. This really sucks.
And shelf paper! Oh, Johnny, I *love* shelf paper!
You've gotten to be like a daughter to me and I wanna share somethin' with ya.
Awww, what's that Mom Kelley?
I go both ways.
Oh.
Hey Pope, why don't you go build yourself a new gym at the Vatican.
I love him, but someday I'm gonna knock him on his ass.
Johnny and the Mothers are playin' Stompin' At the Savoy in Vermont tonight.
[after his sabotaged toilet explodes]

[to Johnny]
You got the number of that other plumber?
(On Johnny Dangerously's payroll) Why don't you ease into the job, by taking a vacation?
But what about crime?
Don't worry. It'll still be here when you get back!
With a father like "Killer" Kelly, it's a wonder neither of you turned out to be a piece 'o shit criminal!
[Johnny sees a steaming pot on the stove]
Whatcha cookin' here ma?
Beer.
With noodles! Great idea!
[Upon learning Johnny is the D.A.'s brother]
Johnny, is this true? 'Cause if it is,
[pause]
I don't know how to react!
Roman Moroni Deported to Sweden. Says He's Not From There.
Sally's place is in the home, and I intend to support her, and I'll do anything - shine boots, drive a hack, blow glass - anything.

[after bathroom has exploded]
Take it easy!
Take it easy? I'm standing here with my dork in my hand!
Dangerously and accomplices dressed as nuns driving a sedan covered with... oh you'll love this... duckies and bunnies.
Calling all cars. Calling all cars. Come to Dooley's bar and grill. I'm buyin'.
Sally's place is in the home and I intend to support her and I'll do anything - shine boots, drive a hack, blow glass. Anything.
Ma, you got to take better care of yourself. I don't want you living like this. I don't want you doing other people's laundry.
What are you saying? Give up me career?

[to Vermin]
Sick dumb-ass!
[Vermin fires at Polly and misses]
You missed, fuck-face!
Say kid, what do they call you?
Impressive.
